H0.text: Kinetic energy converted to potential energy is the type of energy conversion in a hybrid car that uses a braking system to recover energy and store it in batteries.

H1.text: Chemical energy converted to kinetic energy is the type of energy conversion exemplified by a certain type of hybrid car that uses a braking system in which energy is recovered and stored in batteries.

H2.text: Chemical energy converted to thermal energy is the type of energy conversion exemplified by a hybrid car that uses a braking system to recover energy and store it in batteries.

H3.text: Thermal energy converted to potential energy is the type of energy conversion performed by a hybrid car that utilizes a braking system in which energy is recovered and stored in batteries.

A4.text: Regenerative braking converts kinetic energy into electrical energy stored in batteries.

A5.text: Electric motors used in reverse convert mechanical energy into electrical energy.

A7.text: The recovered energy is stored in a reservoir such as a flywheel or high voltage battery.

A10.text: Water is pumped up to a higher lake, converting electrical energy to gravitational potential energy.
